definition: to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to disturb/to annoy/to mix/to stir
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs

sentences.english: They’re stirring up fights over a woman’s right to make her own health care choices.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲婦女健康選擇權益保護而攪和。

sentences.english: Not for him the rough and tumble of the financial marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 當然他也不會在金融市場裏瞎攪和。

sentences.english: It seemed to be her fate to become involved with men whose presence cheapened her.
sentences.chinese: 似乎她命中註定要與那些瞧不起她的男人攪和在一起。

sentences.english: Escalating tensions have even helped rattle global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 緊張局勢甚至攪和得金融市場都更加活躍。

sentences.english: You love rabble-rousing, and you love to bust systems open.
sentences.chinese: 你們愛攪和鼓動，而且你們愛打開爆裂的系統。

sentences.english: The shuffle and snicker become the comedians trademark.
sentences.chinese: 攪和與竊笑成爲那個戲劇演員的標誌。

sentences.english: Cauls mouldy tripes windpipes faked and minced up . puzzle find the meat.
sentences.chinese: 把胎膜發黴的肺臟以及氣管剁碎，攪和在一起來冒充。

sentences.english: But there are forces mucking up the game for those who would profit most from last-mile control.
sentences.chinese: 但是有勢力爲了最後一英里的控制來攪和這場遊戲。

sentences.english: If you are not going to help, don't help.
sentences.chinese: 你要是幫不上忙，就不要瞎攪和。

sentences.english: If you're not going to help, don't help.
sentences.chinese: 你要是幫不上忙，就不要瞎攪和。

definition: sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
reckless/extremely daring
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to be self-interested
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to make eyes/to wink
to define
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to use force
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to act as a matchmaker
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
